alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 01 at 2:12AM MST until March 01 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM CST /10 AM MST/ TO 8 PM CST /7 PM MST/ TODAY FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND WEST TEXAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 20% OR LESS AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND WEST TEXAS... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM CST /10 AM MST/ TO 8 PM CST /7 PM MST/ TODAY FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND WEST TEXAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 20% OR LESS AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND WEST TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...All of southeast New Mexico and West Texas. * TIMING...For the warning, 11 AM CST /10 AM MST/ TO 8 PM CST /7 PM MST/ today. For the watch, late Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * WINDS...Today, southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph, highest winds in the mountains. Thursday, west 30 to 55 mph with gusts to 70 mph, highest winds in the mountains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 percent today. As low as 10 percent on Thursday. * RFTI...4 or near critical to 7 or extreme. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions may have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires. Ensure that chains attached to trailers will not touch the pavement, thereby eliminating the possibility to generate sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
